alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Hamilton; Meigs; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 4:21PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bradley, southwestern Meigs, western Polk and Hamilton Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Signal Mountain to 6 miles west of South Cleveland to near Cohutta. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Cleveland, Benton, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Walden, Lakesite, Charleston, South Cleveland and Fairmount. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
